title: Happiness Is a Warm Gun
description: In the first episode of this hilarious new political comedy ...

title: Passport to Freedom
description: Alan's wife, Sarah, inherits a million pounds....

title: Sex Is Wrong
description: Alan realises that joining a moral crusade....

title: Waste Not Want Not
description: Tory MP Alan B'Stard's dirty dealings have finally caught up with him ...

title: Friends of St. James
description: Alan organises a parliamentary fact-finding expedition....

title: Three Line Whipping
description: Alan is booked to appear on TVAM to discuss an important by-election result....

title: Baa Baa Black Sheep
description: Alan's hateful father-in-law, Roland Gidleigh-Park, threatens to have Alan thrown out ...

title: Alan B'Stard Closes Down the BBC
Fatal Extraction
description: During a television debate Alan B'Stard MP, Member for Haltemprice, falls foul of fellow panelist Georgina Pitt, militant leader of Hackney Council....

title: Live from Westminster
description: Parliament has gone prime time with the introduction of television cameras into the Commons....

title: The Wapping Conspiracy
description: Always eager to help improve the minds of the young ...

title: The Haltemprice Bunker
description: Thrusting his way through the lobby of anti-Nazi protesters....

title: California Here I Come
description: When parliament's man of the moment, Alan B'Stard, flies to California....

title: May the Best Man Win
description: When Piers announces he is getting married to someone ...

title: Piers of the Realm
description: It must be a blue moon because Alan B'Stard is holding....

title: Labour of Love
description: Alan B'Stard's reputation as the most right-wing Tory MP in the House is under threat: Working class fatso Victor Crosby has just won the Accrington by-election for the Conservatives and, through his publicly declared extreme political views, is on the brink of stealing B'Stard's thunder.

title: The Party's Over
description: Major is securely belted in the driving seat of the Tory machine but despite the new leadership, Conservative fortunes are flagging - a severe economic crisis looms; the opinion polls predict the Party's imminent downfall.

title: Let Them Sniff Cake
description: Following the riotous TV appearance in 'Balance', a serious discussion slot chaired by MENSA member Joan Bakewell, Alan B'Stard is branded an animal hater across the front pages of the tabloid press.

title: Keeping Mum
description: In the House of Commons conniving Tory Alan B'Stard faces a barrage of hostility from an Opposition outraged by his proposal for an amendment to the Social Security Bill.

title: Natural Selection
description: During the annual cocktail party at his country residence B'Stard's scathing contempt for his Haltemprice constituents seriously backfires.

title: Profit of Boom
description: The purpose of Alan's USSR tour is to spread the gospel of Capitalism according to B'Stard, as well to acquire several thousand rubles by selling off video cassettes of his free-market sermons.

title: Back from the Mort
description: Alan is back and he is on the warpath.

title: H*A*S*H
description: While Piers Fletcher-Dervish is dealing with the ins and outs of political life, Alan B'Stard is somewhat put out to find himself indebted to his wife Sarah.

title: Speaking in Tongues
description: Brussels is a zoo, and it's getting on top of the new Commissioner for Internal Relations.

title: Heil and Farewell
description: The Molotov cocktails may be raining down on refugee hostels in Germany, but Alan B'Stard is more concerned with potentially explosive plan which he has up his sleeve.

title: A Bigger Splash
description: Alan B'Stard doesn't balk at the Balkans.

title: The Irresistible Rise of Alan B'Stard
description: All hell breaks loose when B'Stard decides to interfere with the mountains of untaxed cash lying hidden in the Channel Islands.
